content: Cannot load save from first game; the game crashes. I'm not the only one with the problem and the Devs don't reply to mails.

Brilliant game, manages to encompass you in its story, gameplay and world. I've never quite seen a mobile game that is this good. Although, my only complaint is that the game is split up into parts. Not a problem with Play Pass, but, it might be annoying when you have to buy each part separately.

Each installment of the Sorcery! series improves upon its predecessor. The highest praise I can give, then, is to say that each game is worth playing in its own right; not just so you can experience the entire narrative, but because of how different an experience each chapter will provide you with. In this chapter, the game focusses on hard choices. Exploring a city and hunting for clues, knowing that with each path you take there is a whole arc that you've chosen not to take. Sublime.
Great story! Tons of choices & possible outcomes. Love it!
Extremely well adapted for Android. Engaging both to play through once and to explore over a long period, seeking the best solution.
Difficulty spike from 1 to 2 is insane. Finished the first game in an hour but couldn't even come close to halfway done without dying or getting robbed or whatever else. A shame, really.

I have played both Sorcery! + Socery! 2 so far and I couldn't put either one down. I carried my game over from the 1st chapter with no issues at all and this chapter was significantly longer (my only negative to the 1st was how short it was). This chapter had so many choices, places to go, interactions, etc. Plus the storyline was far more compelling requiring you find certain information to be able to move on. I enjoyed the challenge and am looking forward to Sorcery! 3

Start with Sorcery! (1st) The 'Choose Your Own Adventure' books made into a game. I can't imagine how difficult and expensive this game was to create and maintain. Every action creates a different path to reach the end. The consequences of your actions carry on through the next 3 games in the series, and beyond - to replay sorcery 1-4 again with increased difficulty because of the choices you made the first time through...
Fope as duck
Crashes when loading cloud save. Please fix this
An excellent entry in the Sorcery saga that still feels like a self-contained experience. An improvement on the first game on every level.
It's fun, but for the price tag, there are plenty of other CYOA games on Android that give equal depth and just as much gameplay.
Wonderful, I would give this 6 stars if I could.

There is a problem everytime I try to load my save file from Sorcery 1 it crashes when I first choose my character. Is there any fix to that? I really want to continue my campaign with my character from ep1
I found it just I was looking for in a dnd like game if you intersted definatly pick this one up
So far every time I try to load my save file from the first game, it crashes the app. Please fix, I really enjoyed the first part and was looking forward to the rest of it.
Crappy is too good a rating. Bad graphics & a bad story line. Choose what the dev wants or die.
Great continuation of a unique take on interactive storytelling. Game mechanics start branching out in this one so it's more than just the next part of the same game.
Downloaded, didn't open, uninstalled. Had the same problem with the first game in this series
Crashes the moment I try to start the game
I found this to be probably the most difficult of the four books, with a lot of searching and branching out of possibilities. But it is great and let's the story change pace.
Crashing after the prologue every time.
remember the books well from my youth and a suitable upgrade must admit, will probably download the four, good stuff

I love this series, however, I painfully have to rate this game 1* because of 1 thing, Swindlestones. They gimped an otherwise beautiful CYOA rpg with a high stress highly luck based mini game as the central focus of gameplay instead of, idk CYOA rpg content that made me love the first one. I'd give full 5 *'s Swindlestones was was optional, or could be disabled, it can't which makes it pointless unless you like Swindlestones which I dont. Tl;dr: They tried to reinvent the wheel & made a square.
First game was great but it crashed on the part where you press your character
Great game!!!!!
A little on the expensive side since you pay for each chapter, nice idea overall though.
Amazing; if you enjoyed the first one at all then definitely get this one.
Crashes when I tap my character to start the game. Loved the first volume and would love to update this to 5 stars once this gets fixed.

OKAY I can't actually play but don't want to give a bad review I'm using my Samsung s7 and it crashes whenever I click my character at the very beginning I loved the first sorcery and if there is any possible fixes I can do to make it work it would be greatly appreciated
App would be great if it didn't crash on start.

The game crashes when I try to access my cloud save from Sorcery! 1 when I'm told to to click on my character to start off, but if I choose the default male or female character, it lets me play. I'd really like to access the cloud save to keep immersion.
I have just finished all the chapter! Great game!
It does not work. It crashes after I click my character in the very first interaction upon starting the game
Amazing game for people with who love driving into well built fantasy worlds!
Loved it
My favorite of the series
There is literally no other game like this.

The app is crashing every time I start with a new character. I am on a Pixel 3 running Android 9. It gets to the character on the map for the first choice and then immediately crashes to my home screen.
amazing and addicting
The absolute best rpg on mobile

I LOVED it! Much more difficult than the first game, but we are seasoned adventurers now, aren't we? 😉 I had to go back some (love that feature), and I got confused once or twice. Figuring it out was FUN, though, not tedious. I thought the city was intriguing. Reallly loved the cast of characters. I hope Flanker makes a return! Superb writing, fantastic game. Great job inkle LTd!

While the first game was fun and had some luck in fighting and a few other events, this game seems to favor luck much more often, and penalizes you for even trying. I'm not interested in wasting time repeating the same event hundreds of times in the hopes of winning once. You lost a hopeful fan of the great CYOA possibilities and intriguing storyline with your implementation of swindledice.
One of the most engaging games I've played in years
Any way to recover old saves? Other than that, amazing game.

My issue with this otherwise good game is that its not made clear when you have "lost." For instance, I may do action X, and 30 minutes later learn that prevents me from doing something else which may or may not prevent me from completing the game. This makes it quite frustrating to have to rewind one you've realized you cannot finish the game. Should I trace back 20 minutes or 1 hour? It's overwhelming when you have to go through the same process again and feels too much like trial and error.
I love this so much...much better than book.

this game is nutters😋..the first book is a breeze..the 2nd is not..getting out of the city is easy..getting out the city in a decent position so you don't die 10 pages into the next book is really hard..devs best way to improve sorcery is to add some randomness to it..if a 3rd of chioses had multiple outcomes you couldn't predict the game would have almost limitless replayabitity.
won't even launch, pricing is a bit shameful considering the first one was over in a flash and it seems none of the additional apps work either.
amazing
the game crashed when i tap the character to begin the adventure. pls help. will gladly change my review when the problem is solved. Xiaomi Pocofone F1 with android 9

No book can ever make a city this epic and in depth. Easy to get lost in and die. Truly testing whether you have the skill to claim the crown. First time I played, I was kind, hated gambling, and got mugged multiple times. The city chewed me up. 7th run, stealing everything, causing fights, and addicted to gambling. I need a real set of Swindlestones/Mindstones.
Game crashes as soon as I tap on character to begin journey, also touch controls are not very responsive
Amazing fun game

Was fun until i got stuck with 3 spells and no way to get 4, this game is 
chaos, i won t play next chapters this gives me a headache

Excellent game! Lots of problem solving and strategizing, great graphics, 
TRY IT! Use my code from the end of Part One of this game: Zebydi. You will 
start Part 2 with a maximum 20 stamina 18 gold and 5 rations. You're 
welcome.😉👍
Excellent adventure!

I can play this again and again; it is similar to the first one but not so much so that it takes away from it's own uniqueness.They have added a fun dice mini game, some great new spells (some which tie in w the first game), and introduced new great characters as well as brought back some from the forst one. Their are so many different paths in a cohesive adventure ♡♡ I recommend this game if you liked the frst one!

VERY linear.  Left with no choices if you want to follow storyline.  Eg. You give gold for chips, gamble and win, the goblin appears. If you follow goblin, ypu cant cash put chips for gold.  If you cash out chips for gold you can't follow goblin.  You are BROKE if you follow goblin, and it takes an hour to get to the gate, teleported and back to cash in your chips for gold.  Then you have to get back to the story... HUGE waste of time and very frustrating.  Can't move backwards unless you rewind so you have to get to gate and teleport.  Seems a short game was lengthened by wasting your time by going in a one-way circle.  I had hopes for something better.
I have a gambling addiction
The game itself is very good. But it gets Very repetitive at the end as i don't know where to go or what to do, and I don't feel like I'm getting enough guidance towards my goal
Sorcery! was great. This is AMAZING. So many options what to do, what to cast, what to say, where to go... played the first three Sorcery! games so far, love this one the most.
No autosave got thrown back to the start 3 times today and am throughly disgusted.

Better written and designed than the first volume, with the same great mechanics. New spells, plus the addition of a gambling game and a much more nonlinear structure, shake up the gameplay a bit without messing too much with the formula. Finding the victorious ending is difficult, but a neat little twist lets you try as much as you need to. Excellent game.
Brings the city port alive in a way the books never could.

So first one better than 2nd. This one main complaint is its like you can get to the end guy and not kill him. So game has built in option to roll back time and acquire items to open last gate. Good thing is you don't loose gold or items being sent back. Crappie thing is you loose alot of incentive to play at that point. Just boring. Basically redo not a walk thru. Loved it up till having to rewind and redo. Just bad bad bad. Basically doesn't matter what you do your getting sent back because games built that way. Nothing matters. Really crappie. Prob try push thru at somepoint. Like half way thru redo just no fun. 😧
One of the greatest RPG I've played so far. Much longer than the first chapter, less linear, with great improvements, like Swindlestones mini game.
Came for Flanker, stayed for the immersive gameplay, branching story paths, and Flanker
Omg
Have installed on my Acer R13 chromebook, but it won't run properly - the screen doesn't fit the window and won't maximise. Sorcery 1 worked perfectly.
Please fix the Rewind! I'm getting sick of having to restart the whole thing because of a fat-fingered error.
good stuff
Incredible, a flexible story that keeps surprising even as you think you've explored it all.
Love it. Incredible.

Loved it, much more content than the first, but where 1 just let you hack through a quick adventure, this one sortof forces you to 'rewind and find' a perfect path...   Still very fun but I was relieved to finish so I could proceed to 3...  80 days is by far my favorite as it doesn't punish for picking arbitrarily the wrong path.  Still had fun and excited to play 3 and 4
Great game! But changed the music :( much prefered the old Vaughn Williams haha
Great follow-up to the first sorcery game, and still one of the best mobile games out there.
replyContent: Sorry about that! I have just released update 1.1.1 which should fix this crash. Please let us know if that works for you.

content: Good game but the most recent update or when my phone updated (galaxy s7 edge) broke the display and is unplayable currently
replyContent: Sorry about that! We'll try to get that fixed ASAP. Can you please subscribe to our beta test so you can get updates more quickly? Here is the link: http://play.google.com/apps/testing/com.inkle.sorcery2

content: Great game, even better than the first one, a must have
Amazing. Even better than the first game. Can't wait to play 3
Buggy ... Most times I launched on Samsung A8 smartphone, the game was off-center on the screen and unplayable.

This was much better then the first one, after fully playing through it i now know and remember every part of the city! I thought of this as an amazing second part of this series and will continue to move onto the third.
Just awesome, and I am a huge Fighting Fantasy fan since I was 12

It's pretty impressive. It certainly took a lot of work to make. I'm not sure if it is worth $5 for the experience. It may be a little short. There is replay value for sure, but some of it feels like more of the same. All caveats about price aside, I will probably buy the sequels.

I looked for games to play on ferry and at work and I was impressed by what I found here. A nice RPG with strange names for places, interesting magic to use and nice twists in where you want to explore the map. It's not an easy game either, so if you're looking for challenge, you'll feel satisfied with this game.
Glitchy rewind ruined the game for me. Waste of time. Developers need to add an undo rewind function. Disappointing.
Excellent story,way way better than the first. A must buy
Way better than part one. I nearly didn't buy part two (since part one was so short).  Inkle should really give part one away for free or combine parts one and two.
Great production value. Great replayability.
You lads smashed it, looked forward to rinsing this on tube journeys for weeks
A perfect end to a legendary tale
Had no issues, simply used my brain. And thank you for the rewind ability.
Much more to do than the first one!
Amazing
Just started and totally addicted. Even better than the first!
Love love love these games! This one so far is my favorite, but you should buy them all.
Bit more involved then i first imagined and i find myself doing it over and over trying 2 work out best and most successful way 2 use everything I find along the way
I loved the first game but this one is even better. Longer, more to do, many different paths and a great story.
... if a little frustrating due to backtracking, yet the game's length does not disappoint.

The first chapter was a bit small and the replays didn't offer much, spells were slightly pointless. All of this stand corrected here, with a complex and fascinating story. Worth the money, on to the next chapter
This game is stupidly hard! Unless you have a rope to get out of a well give up because anything worth having will be lost.
Not working after android update on samsung s2!
Crashes every 5 minutes or less. Lg G5. Please help

I am getting sick of the rewind function not working properly. The times I press the wrong option due to large fingers only to find the rewind option won't take me back. The whole rewind thing is wrong, sometimes it will take you pages and pages back and others not even one. Fix this please, it's frustrating constantly having to restart the whole thing due to accidents.

Welcome back to Sorcery!  One of the best and original sources of text based adventure gaming books that were not played at the cost of one's own imagination.  Now combined with multi-sensory activation through modern tech that has only enhanced the gaming experience.  You have my loyalty Inkle, well done guys, keep on rockin' it.
Amazing game definitely worth a go, but make sure you start from the first game and move on to this
Absolutely love the sorcery series. I have played all three and they are totally worth the money, can't wait for number 4 to come out!

Loved the first one so much I bought this one, and loved this one so much on my first playthru, I bought the third part. Countless hours of fun exploring different paths and different storylines.  Can't wait for part four to come out and finish the story.

After upgrading phones. Sorcery 1&3 transferred. When I informed the developer of this, they said to simply hit the purchase button again and it would download. Wouldn't you know they just charged me twice. I guess it is my fault for following the success of the developer however. Great game just don't trust the devs, as they are in it for as much money as they can grab.

It is broken. Sometimes the competitor wins, even though it doesn't have said dice. Don't bet anything. It's broke to the point it's impossible to win. Please fix. So broke, I'm retracting a star from a otherwise 5 star game example; I'm going against a inkeeper. He says he has 6 threes, when he only even has 3 dice. When I call, he wins somehow, even though he has only three threes. Not a major problem with a whole of the game, but needs fixed either way. Ooooh, oooh... I'm a idiot. Sorry. Most of this is false
loved it so much, I keep reset the game like 15 times already. worth the money...
Much better than the first game. A lot longer and more places to explore.
Runs smoothly on my moto G and is very enjoyable!

SEARCH FOR HELP IF YOU NEED IT...  Sorcery 2 is a great experience. Far richer, deeper, and larger than the first episode. It has a major flaw though, in my opinion, and involves one part of the final puzzle. Compared to the rest of the episode it is poorly implemented and chances are you won't find the answer except by dumb luck or long hours of unnecessary trial and error.  That said, give the episode a full run through, learn the ropes, but don't feel bad if after awhile you're up against a real dead end and need to search for help.
Loved the first installment, loving this one even more! I don't want them to end but I don't want to stop playing!
This is amazing...anyone who loves rpg's, will enjoy this game. Excellent replay-ability!!
The story is great, and it's the perfect format for a touch screen!
Even better than the first one.
Easily worth the money. A masterful translation of the original making full use of the smartphone medium.
Part 2 has what other installments lack; length, great dialogue and difficulty.
Worth the time and the money.  Had to replay it a few times since I could not get enough.
Just finished first game. Too awesome.
I owned these books as a kid, and Inkle has done an amazingly beautiful adaptation here. Better than the books!
Feel like in an amazing tale with all sorts of creatures and try to decide your destiny. Thank you for this gem ;)
This game is brilliant, and Inkle provided instant, friendly, and helpful responses to my feedback. Cannot recommend highly enough.
As soon as i downloaded it i was easily able to play through. Loved the story cant wait to start the next chapter!!!
replyContent: Sorry to hear it's crashing for you! We'll try to get that fixed ASAP.

content: Found it very hard.  Got to the end and it limits how you can go back,  once I did it erased all progress so I guess I just need to play flawlessly?  Kind of not the point in this type of interactive novel.
Please refer to title.

To be honest, this game deserves a 5-star but I bought all three and can't continue my progress. I even tried restarting my entire game, but when I start this one up after I completed one, I can't enter my code. Please help
Loved it
Couldn't get pass the the prologue keep crashing...to bad was looking forward to continuing the story.
replyContent: Hi Tim, sorry about the crash. Have you updated to the latest version? This bug should be fixed in 1.1.3p1.

content: Loved the first one and just started this one, amazing, such a fun and interactive game, very simple to play but also very challenging and interesting! I've played it 4 times, it's so different every time, if you want a very fun interesting one player adventure game to play on and off, defo download!! I would recommend playing number 1 first then this one then 3 as you can carry items over and decisions from the previous game carry over
Great game, great series and developers and quick and helpful if you contact them
replyContent: Edit: glad to hear it's working now!

content: Fantastic!
Es genial! es cm un libro pero RPG el unico problema, q no esta traducido. Por favor traducirlo gracias cuando lo hagan 5 estrellas sin dudarlo
Mediocre game
Couldn't put it down.
Takes me back to my youth. Perfect bunch of games!

Just like the first Sorcery!, but bigger and better. Tons of options, memorable characters, an exceedingly well-written story, a fantastic user interface, and even a surprisingly fun minigame all make this one of my favourite games on the market.
Good story
Annoying failure notifications
Great sequel to part 1. The world is bigger, the story is long and challenging, and it has a high replay value if you want to carry your character over to part 3.
Good time passer.

All I have to say is if u like rpg the old school way with friends and dungeon floor plan and overworld map this is perfect now u can play in the old school game in the digital world by ure self it's worth every penny buy it
A work of art - in app terms

Substantially longer than the first, and much more non linear. There's an amazing amount of new content, with a major new plot line. Inkle apparently collaborated with Steve Jackson on these, and it shows. The new content dovetails seamlessly with the original content from the book. Highly recommended.
I definitely recommend getting this game if you like spending a lot of time on games

How do you get the spellbook back to the first page? Why does praying not result in full healing? Why does drinking not give more (than a few HP) healing? Why are valid spells blocked off by the game? Is this random? Why is nothing explained? Is this the way gaming was when it was a desktop hobby? Why o why does this game exist?
This should be the model of mobile gaming it is straight forward and fun with an engaging plot that will suck you in for hours.
clever and engaging

I was a huge fan of Car Wars back in the day (which Steve Jackson also developed) and I've found Sorcery equally engrossing. The choose-your-own-adventure style of play, the great original artwork, the spells and combat make for a fresh kind of role-playing experience. Get it and enjoy it.
*An improvement over first installment!*  See the title of my review. Did you love these as a kid? Do you like/did you ever like adventure gamebooks? Then stop reading and download this!
It,s the best

I love this series! I grew up on choose your own adventure novels, and "Sorcery!" nails everything I love about them. 5 bucks a pop is pricy, but the style, design and replay factors make it well worth it IMO
Epic role play
Best adventure game I've played in years.
Entertainment for hours. Great for those who love the old, simple RPGs.

Inkle built on their experience to create an adventure that is less linear than the first. The original game book had a set path to follow with no 2nd chances. This version allows something close to free exploration of the city while still making it possible to learn the lines of the gate spell.
Unlike the first episode, this one isn't short and has plenty of content to be interesting, and harder to finish.  I really enjoy the concept, and i think it works well with the mobile platform.
Everyone go buy it now it has been out since April 22 2015!
The first game was awesome, but this one crashes every time I start it on GS3

Enjoyed this, a good story and a real challenge, with surprising depth. Played the book as a teenager, and this brought back a lot of memories. Appreciated the modern updating and the clever tweaks to the gameplay. Looking forward to part 3.
Read above
Finally a cyoa done right. Love the variety of choices and story. Game time seems more than doubled from last book. Keep going in this direction and I'll own every one.

The greatest app I've ever seen or played hands down. I love this game. I don't regret waiting for a second it combines puzzle solving and other intuitive gameplay elements to improve what has already been deemed a highly enjoyable game. This combined with mini games and multiple paths to choose make it fun for all ages!
Awesome app to have but there are loads of typos
Rad
Superb adaptation.
When is the next one coming out?
Was hoping to get my hand on it today as my email read it would be release today, but I'm still waiting >_<.

Loved 1, was loving 2 more until my progress disappeared. After you start a new game the next time you open the game it goes straight to where you left off. It was a feature I liked until the last time I opened the game and was prompted to select a character like it was my first time playing. There is no option to load saved games so the file is just gone. I invested a few hours so I'm a little salty.
Can not wait for the next one grrr give it to me
Love it these books are second only too Joe devers lone wolf nice job.
The spellbook in iOS has excellent page turn animations missing in the Android version.
Period. (can't wait for the other chapters)
It is well worth the money
Great game
A great game
Good storyline with the ability to rollback. Great artwork. Varieties of choices. Hope sequels wun get too expensive.
Just fantastic.
Just be careful you don't accidentally push go back in time unintentionally.

I hope they bundle 1 & 2 when 3 comes out, cause they're great games but 5 bucks a pop is getting expensive. On the other hand, no in-app purchases. Fantastic art, storytelling, and create-your-own-adventure format.
Fantastic game!
Best game on Android
Almost as good as his books!
Desperately awaiting sorcery 3. Please, any news on a release date?
Where's Sorcery! 3? Really looking forward to it!
On a galaxy s 3.

I have had a great time playing this game! I love the way that you can skip back when you mess up and so the ever frustrating "instakill" is no longer the bane of the game book adventurer. Bring on part 3....
I have money in my account put back just for the next game why haven't they released it
This game was very enjoyable! It imbued a keen sense of survival within' the characters and really gets the player involved in the story, So begs the question: When will Sorcery: 3 be released?
Awesome...more to do than part 1...more value for the money.
Amazing game!!!
Hurry I need more. Part 3

Pretty much the same engine, but this chapter is much better than the first book. I recommend playing the first before this, but it's painfully short. Luckly this part is much longer and feels much more developed as an adventure filled with choices and content. I also love that they allow you to import your character from the first as it's a continuation. Looking forward to the last two books.
Well duh...
So much fun!!
Where is Part 3? In the description it says late 2014. Why the delay?
This is  a great sequel to the first instalment. It took a while to come out but it was worth the wait. Is the third ever coming?

Blast from the past with a completely modern touch. Something from the 80's that's actually got better with time (yeah I know there's Kylie's bottom but these are exceptions to the rule). It's taken me an hour a day (at least) for two weeks to hack through to the other side and I was still finding new scenes. Perfect and totally addictive, but I'm gutted that part three isn't available yet. Time to go back to the start and play as my female alter ego (with a bottom like Kylie!)
The original Sorcery is good for sure....But compared to Sorcery 2 It Blows It Out Of The Water!

I have read the gamebooks in the nineties countless times... and I was blown away by this rendition. The politics of Kharé is much richer and detailed, and the whole drama of the nobles infighting and the people suffering adds a mostly welcome layer of depth to the adventure. It is like reading a new book altogether. Keep up the amazing job for the next chapter, can't wait!
Superb, play part 1 first though.

Longer than part 1 and some cool new content but less enjoyable overall. A few encounters didn't have enough options, and at times spells could have been used more creatively. The economy is also very forgiving for a city of thieves. A legendary sword costs just 40 gold and I completed the game with over 100. It would have been great if there was a second solution to get the door spell but the plot is good and I enjoyed it a lot.
Excellent choose your own adventure book type game. Hours of replayability and many ways to play.
Great transition from game book to app. Good mechanic on the ending as well. Hope number 3 is close and as good as the others.

Well this game dude, its good for a reason. I heard about this from the yogscast where they herp derped their way through and had an amazing time, personally i love these types of pick your own path adventures so on an app made from a studio that genuinely cares about the product is well worth the money. And you gotta release part 3 soon, cause I'm gonna play that to death
Best app EVER
I have downloaded and played many games on my phone and have never rated any of them 5 stars even if I liked them until now. This game is quite simply perfect. Can't wait until Sorcery! 3.
Purchased but won't download
What a great adaptation. Loved the first one, this one is even better. Looking forward to the 3rd and 4th installments.
Its longer and more branching than the original, making every journey unique. Still as engrossing and immersive as the first. Great presentation. What's not to like?
The best game I've ever played on a phone. Turn based story-driven multi-choice format is ideal for phone games and this is the best of them all. I'll probably never find all the possible paths :)

The adventures continue in the second installment of this classic fantasy series.  Bigger and better than part 1 - although it is worthwhile beating the shamutanti hills first as it gives a greater advantage to your chances in khare, you can continue your journey with all collected items gained from choices made in part 1. Great story from the mind of Steve Jackson brought into new life with this app. Inkle have done an awesome job with the Sorcery series so far. I'm hooked and can't wait for part 3!
While Part I was very short and linear this one really lives up to the potential. Great game! Can't wait for number three!
this game rocks i sit impatiently for the other games so my badass guy from the very begginning can use the ZED SPELL!!!!
The story is compelling. Swindlestones will keep you coming back

So I've taken my seasoned adventurer from Sorcery! into the city and so far I've lost all my money in dice games, defeated a werewolf and smoked something  dubious with some dark elves. I cannot say how much I love this game. It is just perfect in every way. Congratulations Inkle, you've nailed it again.
Superb gamebook - this and part one are a genuine step above the competition. Surprisingly open, and with a clever mechanic to make its non-linearity work.
Part 2 is even better than part one. Longer story, new side game, and a less linear path than last time
An incredible unexpected adventure, there is a way out of every tight spot!
Really enjoying this and has much more content than the first. This one is worth the $5 price.
This is an incredible game. Easily one of my favorites.
Fantastic game, I am really looking forward to the next one
Simply excellent
Great fun

I have to admit I was leery about gamebooks prior to downloading this. I started with the first Sorcery and began this on IMMEDIATELY after. These games are extremely addictive and a lot of fun! Excellent replay value with many choices to take along ur quest. I look forward to more like this and more in this series!!!
Love the series, the story and artwork are excellent. Only problem: the game changed my character's gender when loading a saved file from part 1...
There's is a lot of good things to say about this game but the price is a bit to high. Overall this a great game for fans of RPG games.
You can drink that hair removal infinitely if you didn't drink it the moment you brought it. Spam that and the character can be invincible in combat. Totally ruined the balance.

Even better than the first part. Pretty hard too.

Excellent game. Cant wait for next feature

Love it, takes me back to the original books. Really well put together.

Wonderful game! I thoroughly enjoyed playing and looking forward to playing again! And I know you guys are having great success with 80 Days Around the World, but I really hope you guys get the third part of Sorcery out soon!
I really like the first Sorcery but this one does not make much sense to me.
The game looks good but all the texts are only half there at the start is sais the city is looming.... And thats where it stops... Same throughout the game.... Can you please tell me why?
So many options, more content compared to part 1,great series!
I always saw this game lurking in the top spots of appstores and finally gave it a try, so amazing in every way, I cant stop playing!
This game is amazing, the storytelling is so engaging and well written you won't believe how much fun you'll have with it!
Thought provoking story in a familiar D&D format.
Adored this game, but after an Android update on my HTC one mini, it will not longer let me click on new blue flags. I can return to previous points, but not advance. Fix this bug please guys!
Love for the first. More for the second.

Inkle have done a great job of capturing the feel of the Sorcery books (I've tried the first one too) with a very slick and pleasing presentation. The game has been expanded and has a nice twist that allows you to see more of Khare than you would in the book at one sitting. Nice options to replay earlier moves, which helps avoid the "make a random choice...oops that's the wrong decision...you are dead" problem of the books! Nice touch. Great ambient audio too. 5 stars! Can't wait for the next one!

I was really excited when I saw that part 2 was available that I immediately picked it up. I was then disappointed to see that my other save files were not accessible. There was only the first one. If there is any way to reset, I wouldn't mind, but so far this is it.
I love this genre of game and this is definitely a well executed one. Have played several times with differing choices made which gives it replay value too.
Live action choose your own adventure very playable and re playable!!

Another great entry in the series, and with a heck of a lot more content than the first. Can't wait for more games like this. Fantastic developers listen and respond as well, the latest update is evidence of that.
I really didn't have faith in android to deliver a good app until I played this.

Absolutely brilliant design, presentation, game play, and story. Blends the best of artistic design, roleplaying, sound design, and best in class interactive fiction. A great game, with story and characters I actually get invested in and care about, all unfolding in a lushly detailed world that is a joy to explore. Compulsively playable and as addictive as a great fantasy novel. Parts one and two are both must buys! Can't wait for part three!
The game is great I've only had one time where the game crashed but I blame my phone more then the game
Great blast from the past, love the intelligent way battles are handled too in a bidding war based on the text. On tenterhooks for the next part... yessssSSSssss...
Very good and much longer game than the first book. Worth the price.
Hands down, best game series on any app store. Keep it up guys!
Sometimes it freezes
Epic

I'm quite satisfied with this purchase. I played the first one at least a dozen times even though it was much shorter. This one has the time travel aspect though so... I might not need as much replay. Looking forward to the next two parts! I hope inkle continues to create or adapt similar interactive novel games.

Brings me back to the days when I played novel-based RPGs by white wolf. Graphics are just about spot on -- understated, but functional. Spell weaving is interesting, though the animation gets old quick, and the storyline is engaging with tons to do. Only thing I felt was lacking is the ability to go back to an area you previously visited without rewinding the storyline. Additionally, the swindlestones minigame is hard at first, but odd its included since its rarely played in game.
I get to the prison and it when I roll the dice it stops and crashes leaving me at my app list. I am refunding because it is a waste of 3.00 pounds!

Everything about this app is better than the first- the story, the choices, the effects, and play time! I give it 5 stars because i could find nothing wrong with it! It's well worth the $5,  and i recommend it to anyone who has the time.

An amazing sequel to it's predecessor, I highly recomend this game to anyone, the fantasy and action for a younger player. The emersive story, action, and just all the work put into the game for older users. The price is highly complained about, but it is truely and excellent orginal experience.
Looking forward to the next installment and more from inkle

I read the reviews on the first one and was blown away by it. The second installment has been equally, if not even more enjoyable! Absolutely worth every penny of the price. I've been raving to anyone who'll listen about this game! A true sleeper game with amazing content.
Where are the Nobles at
Played it so many times I've lost count. The addition of the swinddlebones mini game was both excessively fun and dangerous-- I spend many hours in the gambling house. ;)
Really awesome love the first and this game is even better can't wait for the rest.

Part 2 is EVEN BETTER than Shamutanti Hills. Again it has the original artwork which gave me that rosy glow of nostalgia. But what was much better was that I actually managed to find the complete spell and finish the game which I never managed as a child. Swindlestones is an interesting addition. Seems that you could basically put an hours effort in and win yourself a fortune in gold.

Before I switched to Android, I bought both of these for iOs and I am buying them again because I LOVE the "Sorcery!" games. When are you guys gonna release 3 for Android? I've been sitting on my save file name for ages now, lol.
Immersive!

Sorcery 2 has so many choices and routes, which is great for replayability-- you can also skip back on a choice you just made, which is convenient. The interface and drawing are absolutely beautiful, and the combat system is very creative. Anyone who loves rpgs is guaranteed to love this game.
Just like those adventure books I used to read when I was 10! (But better). Can't wait for pts 3 & 4
I urge everyone to buy it. You will not be disappointed
This game is awesome and surprisingly long
So much depth and length. I found it very challenging and rewarding when I finally manages to finish it!
Great game. Inkle clearly put time, effort and love into this. Length was much better here. Slightly pricey but eventually feels worth the bucks.
This time travel bullshit is annoying it makes the game so hard to finish and ruins the story. Every time i'm put back in time although I know all the spell lines. Ridiculous.
I loved this game. I've read the origional book s and I've read the fighting fantasy as well. Highly Recommended.
Greatest text adventure ever made. Can't wait for the next chapter. Everyone who says this is a rip off should go back to their Call of Duty garbage.
Longer than the first and if possible more complex! Certainly worth the money!

The Hall of Vlada is particularly buggy, and there are a lot of scenarios where the pronoun is misused i.e. calling my female MC 'he'. It seems the game still needs an update or two to live up to its predecessor.
After i entered sewers, game began to freeze at end of each fight. Would be 5 stars except for this. I run it on Galaxy  SIII.
So well done - atmospheric, slick, more than worthy of the fighting fantasy brand.
Good replay value. Much larger than the firat one. Cant wait for the third!
Great !  Could be longer .....but just a desire for more....waiting for sorcery III

A beautiful reinterpretation of the Sorcery classic. Every time I play I find a new little scene. Had a question about loading the cloudsave, asked the developper got an answer later same day. Classy product from classy people.

Better guys, much better. The game has the length to make it more than worth it. You really managed to keep the spirit of the book. Occasionally crashes after fights but not often enough to damage star rating. Set the bar high for 7 serpents.
Well done, this is one of my favorite mobile games

I expected so much more after the glowing reviews. Considering this is essentially a text adventure, more care should have been given to the text, which at times appears to have been badly OCR'd. The wrong words appear here and there. There isn't much of an RPG element and the occasional graphics seem cheesy. It is essentially a multi-pass linear game with options to undo but not revisit until you've reached the gates, at which point you can redo segments up to three times. It is a bit of a confusing mess and nowhere near up to par compared with text adventures 20 years old or more. Disappointed.
Plays well and longer (or can be) than the first.

How did I miss out on these books in my childhood? The game is smooth, beautifully presented, richly system-based interactive fiction. Enthralling. But I don't appreciate being asked to "share" every accomplishment, it cheapens the experience and wrecks the mood.

i just bought this game but every time i see anything anyone im talking to is saying, its only a portion of the sentence, this game looks great but i havent played the 1st one and im interested in the story but i cant read anything people say, only like 10 words then its cut off, fix pls
The best book of the series and a fantastic implementation
Great continuation oh the previous game!
Awesome job! I've played the first one 3 times and will probably do the same here! Bring your other games over...please!

Part 1 in comparison to this is much less lengthy and full of detail but it had more of a bareback and survival feel but this is much more immersive and detailed and is definitely worth the money, brilliant purchase and highly recommend it!
A more than worthy sequel in this increasingly excellent series. Just wish they'd get the next episodes out quicker.
A lot longer version of the first part with the same quality  and interesting story. Cant wait for the 3rd part.

Sorcery! 2 supersedes its predecessor boasting easily double the playtime if not more. Kháre is a devious city of traps brought to life through amazing text and gameplay as well as new mini games such as Swindlestones. Part 2 features much more puzzles and exploration while retaining god action packed fights as frequently as you want them. Definitely worth the price.
One of the best games to have an even better sequel!!
Even more fun then the first. Keep up the great work
